issue.title: [R] Switch to cpp11
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9405](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9405). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Now that it's on CRAN. Faster compile time and better UTF-8 handling are among the benefits that make it seem worth trying at least.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9405?focusedCommentId=17162900) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Also a nice thing is that seems to be non-GPL which makes the legal state of the R binding in the Apache Foundation world less brittle.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9405?focusedCommentId=17162910) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Doesn't change the fact that R itself is GPL though :)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9405?focusedCommentId=17166533) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
That's OK, though, I think it's more that it makes the distribution of the Arrow R libraries and its build/runtime dependencies a bit more favorable

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9405?focusedCommentId=17183635) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Issue resolved by pull request 7819
